citation.article-title: A re-evaluation of the taxonomy of the genus Anaerovibrio, with the reclassification of Anaerovibrio glycerini as Anaerosinus glycerini gen. nov., comb. nov., and Anaerovibrio burkinabensis as Anaeroarcus burkinensis [corrig.] gen. nov., comb. nov.

p.s: Anaerosinus (An.ae.ro.si'nus. Gr. pref. an not; Gr. n. aer air; anaero not (living) in air; L. masc. n. sinus bend; M.L. masc. n. Anaerosinus a curved organism not living in air)
Cells are curved rods or spirals exhibiting a Gram-negative cell wall.
Motile, but motility may be lost in culture.
Cytochrome b and 'lipid F', with octa- and nonaprenologues (ratio 1:2) as the predominating isoprenologues, are present.
The G + C content of the DNA is approximately 35 mol %.
The type species is Anaerosinus glycerini.
